text: hi everyone its Helen here today I will
make Garang muy or Vietnamese fried
chicken custard in salt and pepper mix
as you know in Vietnam traditionally we
don't have chicken as a daily food
we only sell chicken when we have guests
over or at parties for special
ceremonies nowadays chicken is getting
more popular in our daily meal and the
dish I'm making today is also a popular
drinking food let's begin I have here
500 gram of chicken chopped into
bite-size pieces here in Vietnam we like
to eat chicken as a whole with bone-in
skin-on but of course you can choose
your favorite part of chickens in life
the drumstick or the breast to reduce
the powdery smell seasoned with some
grated ginger and then ask some sugar
some salt chicken stock about half a
teaspoon each and also some freshly
cracked pepper
and then one teaspoon each of our stir
sauce adding some eggs for color and
about three to four teaspoon of
cornstarch added one whole egg and later
five that is a bit too much so just add
the yolk only or half of the beaten egg
or you can also skip the egg if you
don't like it toss well to coat and
leave to marinate for about one to two
hours to make the salt and pepper mix
you can elite normal rice sticky rice
and mung beans about one tablespoon each
rings well and praying total rice first
in a pan for about 2 to 3 minutes until
dry separated and opaque then add the
mung beans and toast until dry and
crusty I like to add a few cashew nuts
to add some interesting flavor into the
salt and pepper mix
transfer to a pepper or coffee Grider
together with some sea salt and 1/2
peppercorn it's sea salt in oz available
you can also use table salt too
try and feel powdered you can double or
triple the salt and pepper mix to save
for later use you can use to make some
other dishes like fry frog or shrooms at
the movie album the movie next use a
meat tenderizer to power about three
stalks of lemongrass until shred it into
thin strips and it looks like straw
sprinkle with some cornstarch and then
deep fry until golden brown I also like
to fry some lime leaves to it whereas a
really nice aroma and some crispiness to
the dish very interesting then keep the
oil until nice and bubbly and then
deep-fry the chicken until golden brown
and crispy dropping one piece at a time
to avoid sticking chop up the scallion
both the white and the green pods to the
land of about one inch on the diagonal
and then also thinly slice the pepper
he's about a tablespoon of oil in a
large wok add the minced garlic and fry
until fragrant tossing the scallion and
chili and talked for about 10 seconds
and then transfer to a bowl and set
aside
now tuck in the fried chicken and then
add a few tbsp of the sauce pepper mix
toss well then add the scallion and
chili back and turn off the heat
now it comes to plate place the
different graph in lamb leaves to the
base of the plate to resemble the
chicken nest then transfer the fried
chicken on top and garnish with some
cilantro mmm
amazing the chicken is really crispy and
fragrant and is coated in this beautiful
powdery peppery and nutty salt and
pepper mix so so so so good I hope you
gonna give this recipe a try and if you
do please share photo on instagram with
hashtag helen recipe I always love to
see them also follow me on Facebook and
Instagram for more daily Vietnamese food
thumbs up and subscribe for more video
every Friday thank you for watching
[Music]
